newsitem.title: UK: LME copper nudges higher in late trading.
newsitem.headline: LME copper nudges higher in late trading.

text.p: LME copper edged higher in late inter-office trading on Tuesday evening, continuing the upward drift seen in ring trading.
Around 1900 GMT, three months copper was indicated at $2,287/90 per tonne, up a touch from a kerb close of $2,286.
Widening spreads and a modest draw in stocks earlier in the day have provided support to the market, dealers said.
The market may be gearing up for a retest of layers of resistance from $2,290 to the November 28 peak of $2,313, analysts said.
Aluminium was indicated firmer also at $1,590/93 versus a $1,584 kerb close.
